The Domain Service Pattern

Source: vignettes/patterns/domain_service.Rmd
domain_service.Rmd

Overview

  • Entities and Value Objects are often to fine-grained to provide a convenient access to the capabilities of the domain layer.

  • Domain Service is part of the domain model. That means it expresses Ubiquitous Language in its Bounded Context.

Characteristics of a good Domain Service

  1. The operation relates to a domain concept that is not a natural part of an Entity or Value Object.
  2. The interface is defined in terms of other elements of the domain model.
  3. The operation is stateless.
Make sure you need a service. Stripping away behaviors that belong to Entity overzealously, lead to Anemic Domain Model, where Entities comprise data but not behavior. This is similar to representing an Entity with only a data.frame.

Unit of Work (UoW)

There are no complex layers here. At most this component runs a query against the query store database and maybe serializes the query result into some format for transport (maybe a DTO, but maybe not), if that’s necessary. (Vernon 2013, 141)

UoW Abstract Base Class

  • Similar to python abc module

  • Has the following public methods:

    • new i.e. initialize

    • commit must be implemented

    • rollback must be implemented

    • exit i.e. finalize. This function which calls rollback

UoW Implementations

UoW Database Implementing

  • DBI, dbplyr, RSQLite

UoW Data Structure Implementing

  • R6DS, mainly R6DS::RDict

References

Vernon, Vaughn. 2013. Implementing Domain-Driven Design. 1st Editio. Addison-Wesley Professional.
